purpose.summary: This policy establishes the framework for onboarding new sales representatives into the Company's compensation plans, defining ramp schedules, training requirements, quota phase-ins, and commission eligibility during the initial employment period.
objectives: Define ramp schedules for new sales representatives
Define commission eligibility during initial employment period

appliesTo: All newly hired sales representatives eligible for variable compensation
All sales roles transferred from non-sales positions
All the Company divisions and business units
Internal promotions to sales roles requiring compensation plan transition

definitions.definition: Any sales representative in their first 180 days of employment in a variable compensation role.
The defined timeframe during which a new hire's quota and/or commission rates are adjusted to account for learning curve and territory development, typically 90-180 days.
Progressive increase in sales quota from reduced levels to full quota over the ramp period.
The initial phase (typically 30-60 days) focused primarily on product training, systems training, and territory familiarization.
The date on which a new hire transitions to 100% quota and standard commission rates.

provisions.title: Standard Ramp Schedule
provisions.content: New sales representatives follow a progressive ramp schedule over 5 months.

subProvisions.title: Month 1 (Days 1-30)
subProvisions.content: Training period with 0% of territory quota. Eligible for commission on any closed deals at standard rates.
items: Quota: 0% of territory quota (training period)
Commission: Eligible for commission on any closed deals at standard rates
Focus: Product training, systems training, territory review, customer introductions

subProvisions.title: Month 2 (Days 31-60)
subProvisions.content: Initial selling phase with 25% of territory quota.
items: Quota: 25% of territory quota
Commission: Standard rates apply
Focus: Initial customer meetings, pipeline building, first deals

subProvisions.title: Month 3 (Days 61-90)
subProvisions.content: Active selling phase with 50% of territory quota.
items: Quota: 50% of territory quota
Commission: Standard rates apply
Focus: Active selling, pipeline management, first quota attainment

subProvisions.title: Month 4 (Days 91-120)
subProvisions.content: Near-full productivity with 75% of territory quota. Accelerators not eligible until Month 5.
items: Quota: 75% of territory quota
Commission: Standard rates apply
Accelerators: Not eligible until Month 5

subProvisions.title: Month 5+ (Days 121+)
subProvisions.content: Full Productivity Date: 100% of territory quota with full plan including accelerators.
items: Quota: 100% of territory quota (Full Productivity Date)
Commission: Full plan including accelerators
Status: Standard plan participant

provisions.title: Accelerated Ramp (Experienced Hires)
provisions.content: Alternative schedule for sales representatives with 3+ years industry experience, previous Company employment in sales role, or transfer from competitor in same vertical. Requires Hiring Manager and Sales Operations Director approval.

subProvisions.title: Accelerated Schedule
subProvisions.content: Compressed ramp for experienced hires:
items: Month 1: 50% quota
Month 2: 75% quota
Month 3+: 100% quota (Full Productivity Date)

provisions.title: Extended Ramp (Complex Territories)
provisions.content: For highly technical or complex territories (e.g., specialty medical equipment, large enterprise accounts).

subProvisions.title: Extended Schedule
subProvisions.content: Longer ramp for complex territories:
items: Month 1: 0% (training)
Month 2-3: 25% quota
Month 4-5: 50% quota
Month 6: 75% quota
Month 7+: 100% quota

provisions.title: Commission Eligibility
provisions.content: Defines what new hires are and are not eligible for during training and ramp periods.

subProvisions.title: During Training Period (Month 1)
subProvisions.content: New hires are eligible for commission on deals they personally source and close, split credit if assisting on existing opportunities, and SPIFs/contests if explicitly included.
items: NOT eligible: House accounts assigned to territory (unless actively managed)
NOT eligible: Pipeline inherited from previous rep (unless they close the deal)
NOT eligible: Residual/renewal commissions from prior rep activity

subProvisions.title: Ramp Period Commission (Months 2-4)
subProvisions.content: Full commission eligibility at standard rates on:
items: All new business closed
Upsells and cross-sells to existing customers
Renewals where rep actively engaged customer
House account activity if rep manages relationship

subProvisions.title: Quota Attainment Bonuses
subProvisions.content: Quota attainment bonuses are calculated based on ramped quota, not full territory quota. Example: Rep at 50% ramp quota who achieves 60% of full quota = 120% attainment for bonus purposes.

provisions.title: Territory Assignment
provisions.content: Rules for initial territory assignment, inherited pipeline, and house accounts during ramp.

subProvisions.title: Initial Territory Assignment
subProvisions.content: New hires receive:
items: Defined geographic territory or account list
Access to CRM with full account history
Introduction package with top 20 accounts
Pipeline report showing active opportunities

subProvisions.title: Inherited Pipeline
subProvisions.content: Opportunities in progress from previous rep:
items: Month 1-2: 50% commission to new rep, 50% to departing rep (if applicable)
Month 3+: 100% commission to new rep if they close the deal
Closed deals awaiting implementation: Commission to departing rep

subProvisions.title: House Accounts
subProvisions.content: Large strategic accounts may remain house accounts during ramp:
items: Rep receives reduced commission rate (e.g., 50% of standard) during ramp
Rep transitions to full commission after demonstrating competency
Sales Manager provides coverage during initial period

provisions.title: Training Requirements
provisions.content: Mandatory training during onboarding and certification requirements for transition to full quota.

subProvisions.title: Mandatory Training (Month 1)
subProvisions.content: All new sales reps must complete Week 1-4 training:
items: Week 1: Company orientation, product catalog overview (40+ hours), systems training (CRM, CPQ, ordering), compliance training (HIPAA, anti-kickback, etc.)
Week 2-3: Territory deep-dive with manager, top 25 customer introductions, ride-alongs with senior reps (minimum 5 days), first solo customer meetings
Week 4: Sales process certification, product line certification (core products), first deal submission

subProvisions.title: Ongoing Training (Months 2-4)
subProvisions.content: Continued development during ramp:
items: Weekly manager 1-on-1s
Monthly product training sessions
Quarterly business reviews
Peer mentorship program

subProvisions.title: Certification Requirements
subProvisions.content: To transition to full quota (Month 5+), rep must demonstrate:
items: Product knowledge certification (80% score on assessment)
CRM proficiency (all opportunities logged correctly)
Pipeline coverage (minimum 3x quota in pipeline)
Customer satisfaction (no major complaints during ramp)

provisions.title: Compensation During Ramp
provisions.content: Base salary, commission payments, and draws/guarantees during ramp period.

subProvisions.title: Base Salary
subProvisions.content: Same base salary as fully ramped reps in same role level. No reduction during training/ramp period. Paid biweekly per standard payroll schedule.

subProvisions.title: Commission Payments
subProvisions.content: Paid on same schedule as tenured reps. No draws or guarantees during ramp unless specified in offer letter. Advances available per standard Draws & Guarantees Policy.

subProvisions.title: Draws and Guarantees (If Applicable)
subProvisions.content: Some roles may include guaranteed commission during ramp:
items: Specified in offer letter only
Typical range: $2,000-$5,000/month for first 90 days
Recoverable or non-recoverable per offer terms
Subject to Draws and Guarantees Policy (SCP-008)

provisions.title: Performance Expectations
provisions.content: Minimum performance standards and consequences during ramp period.

subProvisions.title: Minimum Performance Standards (During Ramp)
subProvisions.content: Progressive minimums and targets by month:
items: Month 2: Minimum 10% of ramped quota (2.5% of full quota); Target 50% of ramped quota (12.5% of full quota)
Month 3: Minimum 25% of ramped quota (12.5% of full quota); Target 75% of ramped quota (37.5% of full quota)
Month 4: Minimum 50% of ramped quota (37.5% of full quota); Target 100% of ramped quota (75% of full quota)

subProvisions.title: Performance Review and Consequences
subProvisions.content: Failure to meet minimums results in escalating action:
items: Month 2: Manager coaching, action plan developed
Month 3: Formal performance improvement plan (PIP)
Month 4: Consideration for termination if below minimum

provisions.title: Special Circumstances
provisions.content: Provisions for mid-quarter starts, leaves during ramp, and termination during ramp.

subProvisions.title: Mid-Quarter Start Dates
subProvisions.content: If hired mid-quarter:
items: Quota prorated based on days remaining in quarter
Commission eligibility begins on start date
Ramp schedule begins on start date (not quarter start)

subProvisions.title: Leaves of Absence During Ramp
subProvisions.content: If new hire takes leave during ramp period:
items: Ramp schedule pauses during leave
Upon return, rep resumes at same ramp stage
Example: Rep completes Month 2, takes 30-day leave, returns to Month 3 ramp

subProvisions.title: Termination During Ramp
subProvisions.content: Treatment depends on type of termination:
items: Voluntary resignation: Commission paid on all closed deals per standard policy, no commission on pipeline, training costs not recovered
Involuntary termination: Commission paid on deals closed before termination date, no commission on pending deals, Company may recover training costs if within first 90 days (per offer letter)

provisions.title: Internal Transfers
provisions.content: Rules for sales-to-sales and non-sales-to-sales transfers.

subProvisions.title: Sales to Sales Transfers
subProvisions.content: Ramp varies by transfer type:
items: Same product line, different territory: No ramp period, immediate 100% quota
Different product line, same territory: 30-day training (0% Month 1), Month 2+ 100% quota
Different product line, different territory: Standard ramp applies (Months 1-4)

subProvisions.title: Non-Sales to Sales Transfers
subProvisions.content: Internal transfers from non-sales roles treated as new hire with standard ramp schedule. May receive preferential consideration for accelerated ramp if internal product knowledge is strong.

provisions.title: Manager Responsibilities
provisions.content: Sales managers must fulfill specific responsibilities during the onboarding process.

subProvisions.title: Manager Onboarding Activities
subProvisions.content: Required activities by phase:
items: Week 1: Provide territory overview, schedule customer introductions, assign peer mentor, review compensation plan
Month 1: Daily check-ins for first 2 weeks, weekly 1-on-1s, attend first 3-5 customer meetings, provide CRM/systems access
Months 2-4: Weekly 1-on-1s reviewing pipeline, monthly performance review, coaching needs identification, approve quota adjustments if needed
Month 5 (Full Productivity): Final ramp review meeting, certification approval, transition to standard management cadence

federalLaws: HIPAA (Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act)
